byline.contributor: Rick Rojas and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER, AL BAKER and LIZ ROBBINS

abstract: New York City Police Officer James Frascatore is stripped of his gun and badge after rough arrest of retired tennis star James Blake, who was misidentified as suspect in fraudulent credit card ring; arrest was brought to light only after Blake, who was planning to make appearance at United States Open, spoke to media about incident; Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J Bratton issue apologies to Blake.
lead_paragraph: “This shouldn’t have happened and he shouldn’t have been treated that way,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said about the mistaken arrest of the retired tennis star. The police commissioner also apologized.

headline.main: James Blake’s Arrest Brings Swift Apologies From New York Officials
headline.print_headline: Swift Apologies in Harsh Arrest of a Tennis Star

snippet: “This shouldn’t have happened and he shouldn’t have been treated that way,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said about the mistaken arrest of the retired tennis star. The police commissioner also apologized.
